query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

result.title: Report on user testing
result.description: Report on user testing: results of the user testing by members of the consortium and a cross-section of users from different userclasses identified in D3.1, and the actions to be taken to address concerns and issues that were identified in the user testing.

result.title: Partner’s Handbook to the Experimental Scheme
result.description: This Handbook will feature full indications on how to set up and execute the pilot initiative. The Handbook will be available to innovation agencies willing to experiment the scheme before its evaluation (e.g. those willing to act as early adopters) and disseminated for external use and uptake starting M5. This deliverable will be subject to dissemination.

result.title: D6.3 LEA Awareness rising strategy and campaign
result.description: Presents all activities, instruments (incl. corporate identity and dissemination package) and methods that should be used by all project partners to achieve best possible results. It includes a specific timetable that shows when dissemination material is available; when results are ready to be presented and when administrative issues are to be carried out (e.g. reporting). Including ORDP from task 1.4, D1.3.

result.title: D3.5 Public demand LEARNTECH 2030
result.description: This report will form part of LEA Roadmap as a final result of LEA project and for future impact and will be based upon EC Action plan on Demand policies and its recommendations. The target group of this report is policy level and as quality assurer GR will support this task before final version.

result.title: D6.5 Reports on dissemination activities
result.description: Continuous updates of individual partners’ report with two summary reports analysing the activities and deducting possible improvements and recommendations at interim stage and introducing a follow-up approach at final project stage. Delivered in M12 and M24.

project.title: LEARNING TECHNOLOGY ACCELERATOR

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

result.title: D3.3 PPI need analysis report
result.description: This report contains the cross border needs of the Buyers group for the future PPI of STEM PLE:s and is to be considered the first baseline of the PPI preparations. Based upon these needs the PPI preparation of the open market consultation will be held. A second report will be produced in M 14 using the same methodology in order to map the needs/ demands of LEA partners to prepare a PCP within the framework of the LEA and will be a cross task with WP 5.

project.title: LEARNING TECHNOLOGY ACCELERATOR

programme.title: Innovation procurement networks

category.title: Topic

programme.title: INDUSTRIAL LEADERSHIP - Leadership in enabling and industrial technologies - Information and Communication Technologies (ICT)

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

result.title: D3.1 LEARNTECH procurement Analysis
result.description: This deliverable contains the mapping of the procurement of learning technology of Education in Europe and will be used in order to understand how to use the LEA-N network with a broad approach. It also includes methodologies for user/demand driven input from procurers and end users, including identification of barriers from the demand side. Thus, this deliverable will help to identify the most appropriate way of forming and operating the procurer network in order to contribute attaining the objectives of Learning Accelerator project.

result.title: D6.1 LEA Web page
result.description: LEA webpage will on the one hand serve as project website and on the other as procurer network site. Furthermore, the website will be connected with Imaile.eu and also use the structure of different portals in order to filter information for the individual target groups. Social media profiles will be directly connected and embedded in the news section and an internal web space will be created as storage and documentation space for all project partners as well as for evaluators of the EC.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

programme.title: Food Systems

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

programme.title: Evidence-based decision-making to change social norms towards zero food waste

category.title: Topic
category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

category.title: EU research policy /Research policies in the EU

programme.title: Food, Bioeconomy Natural Resources, Agriculture and Environment

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

result.title: Evidence-based analysis of FLW actions/tools
result.description: Report on the evidence-based analysis of FLW actions and tools linked to task 1.2, based on data originating from desk-top research, structured interviews and open FLW-related datasets. The report will also provide results from the impact assessment of previous FLW actions.

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

project.title: Changing practices and Habits through Open, Responsible, and social Innovation towards ZerΟ fοod waste

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

programme.title: Food Systems

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

programme.title: Evidence-based decision-making to change social norms towards zero food waste

category.title: Topic
category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

programme.title: Food, Bioeconomy Natural Resources, Agriculture and Environment

result.title: CHORIZO FLW ‘Insighter'
result.description: a datahub to store: (i) the results of the evidence-based analysis of previous/ongoing FLW actions (T1.2); (ii) the new empirical evidence on social norms, and consumer, organisation and charity (e.g. food banks) behaviour in relation to FLW (T2.4)
